tutorial.title: Using Flex Direction
tutorial.descriptionContent: Learn how to quickly rearrange HTML elements with Flexbox.

lessons.title: Intro
lessons.interactiveContent: Flexbox lets us change the content layout without touching the HTML. Press the buttons to see it in action.

lessons.title: Flex-direction
lessons.interactiveContent:
To control the direction elements are displayed in, we use the flex-direction property.

Make sure to pick flex-direction.

lessons.title: Default value
lessons.interactiveContent:
The default value for flex-direction is row. Flexbox elements have this value even if we don't code it.

Make sure to pick row.

lessons.title: Direction and orientation
lessons.interactiveContent:
flex-direction: row means items start from the left of the container and are shown horizontally in the order they're in the HTML.

Make sure to pick row.

lessons.title: Column
lessons.interactiveContent:
We can also set flex-direction to column. Here, the items begin at the top and are placed vertically in the order they're in the HTML.

Make sure to pick column.

lessons.title: Stretch
lessons.interactiveContent:
When flex-direction is set to column, elements stretch out to fill the container's width.

Make sure to pick column.

lessons.title: Question: Flex-direction
lessons.interactiveContent:
What does this code display?

Flex items aligned in a columnFlex items aligned in a row

Flex items aligned in a column.

lessons.title: Question: Default value
lessons.interactiveContent:
What is the default flex-direction value applied to flex items?

rowcolumn

Make sure to pick row.

lessons.title: Question: Direction and orientation
lessons.interactiveContent:
What does flex-direction: row do?

It displays elements horizontally from left to rightIt displays elements horizontally from right to left

It displays elements horizontally from left to right.

lessons.title: Question: Column
lessons.interactiveContent:
What does flex-direction: column; do?

It displays elements vertically from top to bottomIt displays elements horizontally from top to bottom

It displays elements vertically from top to bottom.

lessons.title: Question: Stretch
lessons.interactiveContent:
How do we know these flex items will be 200px wide?

Because flex-direction: column; means they stretch to fill their container's widthBecause that's how wide the body element is

Because flex-direction: column; means they stretch to fill their container's width.

lessons.title: Example: Flex-direction
lessons.interactiveContent:
Code the flex-direction property.

Make sure to type flex-direction.

lessons.title: Example: Default value
lessons.interactiveContent:
Set flex-direction to its default value.

Make sure to pick row.

lessons.title: Example: Direction and orientation
lessons.interactiveContent:
Make these flex items display in a single row.

Make sure to type row.

lessons.title: Example: Column
lessons.interactiveContent:
Code column to make the flex items display in a column.

Make sure to type column.

lessons.title: Example: Stretch
lessons.interactiveContent:
Code the margin so that the flex items can stretch to 200px in width.

Make sure to pick 0px.

lessons.title: Intro
lessons.interactiveContent: Flexbox lets us change the starting point of flex items, allowing us to easily reverse a layout if we ever need to.

lessons.title: Row reverse
lessons.interactiveContent:
To change the starting position for flex items to the right side of a container, we can use row-reverse.

Make sure to pick row-reverse.

lessons.title: Row reverse explanation
lessons.interactiveContent:
flex-direction: row-reverse means items start from the right of the container and are shown in the order they're in the HTML.

Make sure to pick row-reverse.

lessons.title: Column reverse
lessons.interactiveContent:
If we want to reverse the direction of columns, we can use column-reverse.

Make sure to pick column-reverse.

lessons.title: Column reverse explanation
lessons.interactiveContent:
flex-direction: column-reverse means items start from the bottom of the container and are shown in the order they're in the HTML.

Make sure to pick column, followed by -, and finally reverse.

lessons.title: Column reverse height
lessons.interactiveContent:
When using column-reverse, the change becomes more obvious when the container's height is greater than that of the items.

Make sure to pick 300px.

lessons.title: Question: Row reverse
lessons.interactiveContent:
What does row-reverse do?

Reverses the starting position for flex items displayed in a rowMakes elements display in a column

Reverses the starting position for flex items displayed in a row.

lessons.title: Question: Row reverse explanation
lessons.interactiveContent:
What will this code display?

The numbers 4, 3, 2, 1 on the right side of the containerThe numbers 1, 2, 3, 4 on the right side of the container

The numbers 4, 3, 2, 1 on the right side of the container.

lessons.title: Question: Column reverse
lessons.interactiveContent:
What will this code display?

The numbers 4, 3, 2, 1 in a columnThe numbers 1, 2, 3, 4 in a row

The numbers 4, 3, 2, 1 in a column.

lessons.title: Question: Column reverse explanation
lessons.interactiveContent:
What happens when we set flex-direction to column-reverse;?

Flex items start from the bottomFlex items start from the top

Flex items start from the bottom.

lessons.title: Question: Column reverse height
lessons.interactiveContent:
What happens when we code flex-direction: column-reverse; without setting a height value for the container?

The container's height is the total height of its flex-itemsThe container's height is the same as the <body> element's height

The container's height is the total height of its flex-items.

lessons.title: Example: Row reverse
lessons.interactiveContent:
Code row-reverse.

Make sure to type row-reverse.

lessons.title: Example: Row reverse explanation
lessons.interactiveContent:
Set the flex-direction property to the appropriate value to make Start appear near the right edge of the container.

Make sure to pick row-reverse.

lessons.title: Example: Column reverse
lessons.interactiveContent:
Code column-reverse.

Make sure to pick column, followed by -, and finally reverse.

lessons.title: Example: Column reverse explanation
lessons.interactiveContent:
Make Start appear near the bottom edge of the container when flex-direction is set to column-reverse.

Make sure to pick Start, followed by End.

lessons.title: Example: Column height
lessons.interactiveContent:
Starting from the bottom of the container, display Start, Middle, and End in that order. Keep in mind the flex-direction is column-reverse.

Make sure to pick Start, followed by Middle, and finally End.
